title: money
comment: Scripture stresses the positive and negative aspects of money, making it clear that the pursuit or love of money can easily lead to spiritual decay.

children.title: money, attitudes to
children.comment: Money can be a blessing or a snare according to one's attitude.

children.title: Money as a gift from God

seealsos.comment: the parable of the rich fool

children.title: Examples of those led astray by the love of money
Gifts and qualities that are better than money
money, stewardship of
children.comment: The righteous handling of money is an important practical test of godliness.

children.title: Not at the expense of justice
Not at the expense of health
Not at the expense of witness
Not at the expense of spiritual well-being
By work, trade, investment or inheritance
Money must be cared for diligently
Money must be used in a God-honouring way
For the support of the family
For benefiting the poor, especially God's people
For the work of God's kingdom
Examples of godly people who have used their money well
Those who were wealthy but godly
Those who had little but gave much
money, uses of
children.comment: Monetary transactions have taken place from the earliest biblical times. Originally precious metals were weighed out; coins were introduced later.

For the purchase and sale of food
